alert.note: Alert for Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 9:39PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Warrick, southern Vanderburgh and northern Henderson Counties through 915 PM CST... At 839 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Henderson, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Evansville, Newburgh and Melody Hill around 855 PM CST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Chandler. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 1 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
